content.question: Within a forest ecosystem, there is a large amount of diversity among members of a warbler species. Of the following stages of meiosis illustrated for a typical cell, which contributes most to diversity among the warblers?

choices.label: The figure shows four duplicated chromosomes in a cell. Each duplicated chromosome is shown with a circle halfway along its length. Two of the duplicated chromosomes are unshaded and located on the left side of the cell, with one duplicated chromosome directly above the other. Lines are drawn starting from the circle on each chromosome and extending to the left of the cell. The other two duplicated chromosomes are shaded and located on the right side of the cell, with one duplicated chromosome directly above the other. Lines are drawn starting from the circle on each chromosome and extending to the right of the cell.

The figure shows 8 chromatids, with four chromatids on the left side of the cell and four chromatids on the right side of the cell. The top four chromatids, two on the left and two on the right, are unshaded, and the bottom four chromatids, two on the left and two on the right, are shaded. Each chromatid is shown with a circle halfway along its length, and lines are drawn starting at the circles and extending toward the side of the cell nearest the chromatid.

The figure shows four duplicated chromosomes in the center of a cell, with one pair of duplicated chromosomes located directly above the other pair of duplicated chromosomes. The pair of duplicated chromosomes at the top of the cell appears as follows: the duplicated chromosome on the left is unshaded except for an area at the tip of the right chromatid that is shaded; the duplicated chromosome on the right is shaded except for an area at the tip of the left chromatid that is unshaded. The pair of duplicated chromosomes near the bottom of the cell appears as follows: the duplicated chromosome on the left is unshaded and the duplicated chromosome on the right is shaded. Each duplicated chromosome is shown with a circle halfway along its length, and lines are drawn starting at the circles and extending toward the side of the cell nearest the duplicated chromosome.

The figure shows two duplicated chromosomes aligned along the midline of the cell. The first duplicated chromosome is located above the second duplicated chromosome and is shaded. The second duplicated chromosome is located below the first duplicated chromosome and is unshaded.

content.answer: The figure shows four duplicated chromosomes in the center of a cell, with one pair of duplicated chromosomes located directly above the other pair of duplicated chromosomes. The pair of duplicated chromosomes at the top of the cell appears as follows: the duplicated chromosome on the left is unshaded except for an area at the tip of the right chromatid that is shaded; the duplicated chromosome on the right is shaded except for an area at the tip of the left chromatid that is unshaded. The pair of duplicated chromosomes near the bottom of the cell appears as follows: the duplicated chromosome on the left is unshaded and the duplicated chromosome on the right is shaded. Each duplicated chromosome is shown with a circle halfway along its length, and lines are drawn starting at the circles and extending toward the side of the cell nearest the duplicated chromosome.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
